required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Measuring Exercise's Effects on Molecular Mechanisms of Disease Progression in Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Evaluate Feasibility of Measuring Exercise's Effects on Molecular Mechanisms of Disease Progression in Newly Diagnosed Prostate Cancer Patients Undergoing Radical Prostatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to evaluate the feasibility of a larger clinical trial assessing an exercise program during the "teachable moment" in patients with prostate cancer and measuring its effect on tumor apoptosis signaling, lipogenesis and steroidogenesis. Participants will be randomized between a 4-12 week exercise program or to standard of care only. Participants will be assessed at screening, baseline (day 0), throughout the trial intervention (days 1-84), post-intervention visit (prior to radical prostatectomy) and final study visit 6-months post-radical prostatectomy. At each assessment, physical, biological samples and psychosocial assessments will take place.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Number of patients screened per month
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of recruitment to end of recruitment

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Number of patients enrolled per month
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of recruitment to end of recruitment

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Proportion of screen eligible patients who enroll
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of recruitment to end of recruitment
From date of randomization to end of treatment intervention for each participant, an average of 4-12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Rates of adherence to protocol for the exercise intervention arm and control arm
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to end of treatment intervention for each participant, an average of 4-12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Proportion of planned assessments that are completed respectively
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to end of study for each participant, an average of 7 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Godin Leisure-Time Exercise questionnaire (GLTEQ) and activity logs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of activity at baseline, during the study and at the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Anthropometrics (i.e. BMI & waist circumference)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of baseline versus end of study anthropometrics

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Aerobic fitness using a submaximal graded exercise test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of baseline versus end of study aerobic fitness

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Functional fitness using the 30-second chair stand and 30-second arm curl
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of baseline versus end of study functional fitness

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Muscular strength test upper and lower extremity using the 1RM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of baseline versus end of study muscular strength

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Fitness: Blood pressure and pulse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of baseline versus end of study blood pressure and pulse

secondary_outcome.measure: Biological: Collection of urine, blood, biopsy and RP specimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Ability to collect these samples for each participant will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychosocial: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Prostate questionnaire (FACT-P)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of questionnaire scores at baseline versus end of study

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychosocial: Centre for Epidemiologic Studies Depression scale (CES-D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of questionnaire scores at baseline versus end of study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of questionnaire scores at baseline versus end of study

secondary_outcome.measure: Psychosocial: International Index of Erectile Function scale (IIEF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (month 0), pre-surgery (4-12 weeks) and 6-months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of questionnaire scores at baseline versus end of study

arm_group.description: The exercise program is a 4-12 weeks progressive combined resistance and aerobic exercise for participants from time of diagnosis to RP. Participants will undergo twice weekly group-training (four-six participants/group) combined aerobic-resistance sessions (1hr per session), supervised by trained exercise therapists. In addition, participants will undergo home-based aerobic exercise independently three times a week with the goal to meet the current physical activity guidelines for cancer survivors (150min/week of moderate intensity aerobic activity and two resistance training sessions per week). Participants will also be supplied with the Canadian Physical Activity and Sedentary Behavior Guidelines Handbook and accompanying Log Sheets.
Participants will be asked to exercise as they normally would and will be asked to record their exercise activity on provided activity logs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Completed Pre-Screening Consent Form
- Men with CaP, who are deemed suitable by a urologist for RP
- Engaging in <90 minutes/week of moderate-to-vigorous exercise
- BMI <40
- Age >19
- Able to speak and read English (to be able to complete questionnaires)
- Willing to comply with all study procedures (including committing to twice-weekly visits to the study exercise facility and exercise at home) and be available for the duration of the study
- Provide signed and dated informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Men with a medical, musculoskeletal condition or use of mobility aid that prevents participation in the exercise intervention.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Urologic Sciences, University of British Columbia
